experience: You and Sue both know Matt Greene, Claudia Reilly, and 64 others

My Son-in-law TJ received his Bachelors Degree and I feel compelled to mention it. He is a Veteran, father of 6, worked full time, and farmed to get through college.  He used his veteran benefits and a lot of hard work to make it happen. But he is too humble to mention it or even walk down the isle. Over the weekend he just pulled out his diploma from the mailing tube to show me. He laughed that I was so excited. He didn't know others would understand the importance and struggle it takes to get a degree as a returning adult veteran. (I do).  Please feel free to like this post so I can show him others appreciate what he accomplished.  Way to go TJ!

Director of Utilization Management- Mesa, AZ job - Community Bridges, Inc. - Tucson, AZ

• Full cycle recruiting for corporate roles; Human Resources, Marketing, Construction, Sales/Business Development, Information Technology, Auditing• Manage internal and external job ads, review resumes, recruit passive candidates through social media sites, conducts telephone screenings, provides hiring manager with qualified candidates and facilitate in-person interviews• Establish and maintain good interdepartmental relations; develops relationships with professional affiliations and recruiting vendors

• Develop and implement strategic initiatives for recruiting diverse talent in multiple sites• Partner with hiring managers to develop plans for key staffing initiatives• Manage full cycle recruiting process to meet the various staffing goals across all levels within multiple business units• Track and report key metrics designed to measure and predict hiring activity

• Develop and maintain successful ongoing relationships with hiring managers, providing high level of customer service• Sourced and recruited for remote and multi-site locations• Passive recruiting to build applicant pool pipeline for current and future positions
• Point-of-contact throughout the customer life cycle including but not limited to welcome calls, celebrations calls and ongoing maintenance of their site

Sue is an exceptional finder of talent.    I’ve had the pleasure to work with Sue on a number of unique (and challenging) personnel requests over the last 2 years.    The candidates she provides always fit the specific need and are vetted very well.  I can have confidence that when I interview the candidates she provides, the future employee is going to be a good fit.     Her skill, energy, enthusiasm, organization, talent, and attitude are unmatched.

I first met Sue when she came to our Corporate Headquarters for training.  I had the pleasure of sitting down with her to teach her some of our practices, then actually work with her once she returned to her home office.  I couldn't have asked for a better coworker to work with on some of the most difficult jobs I have ever worked.  She always came into every conversation and situation with a positive mindset and a bundle of unmatched energy.  She does a great job of partnering with her customers to fill their needs.  She really is an asset to our team and any team that she works with.
